Increase in COVID cases? Of course there are. Last March and April they were doing 7,000 to 8,000 tests a day in this country. They are now doing about 1.2 million tests a day, so we are finding many more cases. Doesn't mean those cases weren't there all along, in just means now we are finding more of them. Even with that, death rates are down. Reporting how many new cases there are means nothing unless you also report how many tests have been conducted.
